Quotes: He who molds the public sentiment... makes statutes and decisions possible or impossible to make.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: The best way to get a bad law repealed is to enforce it strictly.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea;but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: If once you forfeit the confidence of your fellow-citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: How many legs does a dog have if you call the tail a leg? Four. Calling a tail a leg doesn't make it a leg.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right;a single experiment can prove me wrong.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: An empty stomach is not a good political adviser.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has merely made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: An education which does not cultivate the will is an education that depraves the mind.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: We reproach people for talking about themselves;but it is the subject they treat best.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: The poor have to labour in the face of the majestic equality of the law, which forbids the rich as well as the poor to sleep under bridges, to beg in the streets, and to steal bread.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: We make war that we may live in peace.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: You can bear your own faults, and why not a fault in your wife?
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: He that waits upon fortune, is never sure of a dinner.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Faith indeed tells what the senses do not tell, but not the contrary of what they see. It is above them and not contrary to them.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: The consciousness of the falsity of present pleasures, and the ignorance of the vanity of absent pleasures, cause inconstancy.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Nothing is as approved as mediocrity, the majority has established it and it fixes it fangs on whatever gets beyond it either way.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Credit is a system whereby a person who can not pay gets another person who can not pay to guarantee that he can pay.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Nothing is permanent in this wicked world - not even our troubles.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quotes: An unjust peace is better than a just war.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The more laws, the less justice.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: In a disordered mind, as in a disordered body, soundness of health is impossible.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: There are people who have money and people who are rich.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: He who speaks without modesty will find it difficult to make his words good.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Never give a sword to a man who can't dance.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: He who learns but does not think, is lost! He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: I think governments can't do much.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quotes: Tis hard to fight with anger, but the prudent man keeps it under control.
Author: Democritus

Quotes: I'm simply an accident. Why take it all so seriously?
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: All our words from loose using have lost their edge.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Never think that war, no matter how necessary, nor how justified, is not a crime.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Rebellions of the belly are the worst.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: The place of justice is a hallowed place.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: We say little, when vanity does not make us speak.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: We are more often treacherous through weakness than through calculation.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: We seldom find any person of good sense, except those who share our opinions.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: There are very few things impossible in themselves;and we do not want means to conquer difficulties so much as application and resolution in the use of means.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: It is from a weakness and smallness of mind that men are opinionated;and we are very loath to believe what we are not able to comprehend.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Nothing hinders a thing from being natural so much as the straining ourselves to make it seem so.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: It is comforting to reflect that the disproportion of things in the world seems to be only arithmetical.
Author: Franz Kafka

Quotes: Fanatics are picturesque, mankind would rather see gestures than listen to reasons.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: We hear only those questions for which we are in a position to find answers.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Blessed are the forgetful: for they get the better even of their blunders.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Insanity in individuals is something rare - but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: If there is something to pardon in everything, there is also something to condemn.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Everything that goes into my mouth seems to make me fat, everything that comes out of my mouth embarrasses me.
Author: Gabriel Jose Garcia Marquez

Quotes: Better never than late.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Few of us have vitality enough to make any of our instincts imperious.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Democracy is a form of government that substitutes election by the incompetent many for appointment by the corrupt few.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Democracy substitutes election by the incompetent many for appointment by the corrupt few.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: If all the economists were laid end to end, they'd never reach a conclusion.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: The faults of the burglar are the qualities of the financier.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: If there was nothing wrong in the world there wouldn't be anything for us to do.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Capitalism has destroyed our belief in any effective power but that of self interest backed by force.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: If you must hold yourself up to your children as an object lesson, hold yourself up as a warning and not as an example.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Will not a tiny speck very close to our vision blot out the glory of the world, and leave only a margin by which we see the blot? I know no speck so troublesome as self.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution;one makes a revolution in order to establish a dictatorship.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: But if thought corrupts language, language can also corrupt thought.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Saints should always be judged guilty until they are proved innocent.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Patriotism is usually stronger than class hatred, and always stronger than internationalism.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: A family with the wrong members in control;that, perhaps, is as near as one can come to describing England in a phrase.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Political chaos is connected with the decay of language... one can probably bring about some improvement by starting at the verbal end.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: It is almost universally felt that when we call a country democratic we are praising it;consequently, the defenders of every kind of regime claim that it is a democracy, and fear that they might have to stop using the word if it were tied down to any one meaning.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Enlightened people seldom or never possess a sense of responsibility.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: I doubt whether classical education ever has been or can be successfully carried out without corporal punishment.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Exercise is bunk. If you are healthy, you don't need it: if you are sick you should not take it.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: A market is never saturated with a good product, but it is very quickly saturated with a bad one.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Hatred is active, and envy passive dislike;there is but one step from envy to hate.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: The hardest thing to see is what is in front of your eyes.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: I have no consistency, except in politics;and that probably arises from my indifference to the subject altogether.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Climate is what we expect, weather is what we get.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Patriot: the person who can holler the loudest without knowing what he is hollering about.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: It ain't what you don't know that gets you into trouble. It's what you know for sure that just ain't so.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Suppose you were an idiot, and suppose you were a member of Congress;but I repeat myself.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: We have the best government that money can buy.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: There is no distinctly American criminal class - except Congress.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The more you explain it, the more I don't understand it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Let us make a special effort to stop communicating with each other, so we can have some conversation.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: A learned fool is more a fool than an ignorant fool.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: The promise given was a necessity of the past: the word broken is a necessity of the present.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: Everything popular is wrong.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: There is no necessity to separate the monarch from the mob;all authority is equally bad.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: If only we could pull out our brain and use only our eyes.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: A businessman is a hybrid of a dancer and a calculator.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: A man's true secrets are more secret to himself than they are to others.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: A man who is 'of sound mind' is one who keeps the inner madman under lock and key.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: That which has been believed by everyone, always and everywhere, has every chance of being false.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: He who is not a good servant will not be a good master.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Tyranny naturally arises out of democracy.
Author: Plato

Quotes: He who steals a little steals with the same wish as he who steals much, but with less power.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Delay is preferable to error.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: When a man is out of sight, it is not too long before he is out of mind.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Boredom is the legitimate kingdom of the philanthropic.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: Odd how the creative power at once brings the whole universe to order.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: Indeed, history is nothing more than a tableau of crimes and misfortunes.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The best way to be boring is to leave nothing out.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: It is forbidden to kill;therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: I say there is no darkness but ignorance.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Boldness be my friend.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: How poor are they that have not patience! What wound did ever heal but by degrees?
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Nothing can come of nothing.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Mind your speech a little lest you should mar your fortunes.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: In a false quarrel there is no true valor.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: When words are scarce they are seldom spent in vain.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Truly, I would not hang a dog by my will, much more a man who hath any honesty in him.
Author: William Shakespeare
